taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs solitarily in rivers, ponds and ditches.  Also found in swamps (Ref. 1479).  Feeds on worms, crustaceans and insects (Ref. 7020).  Used for behavioral studies (Ref. 4537). Length indications of up to 8 cm in some publications are exaggerated (Ref. 89918).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  Ganges River drainage in India, Bangladesh, and Nepal, from Himachal Pradesh (Yamuna River) to the estuary; the Mahanadi River drainage; Assam lowlands close to Brahmaputra (Kaziranga, Gauhati, and Dibru River) (Ref. 46238).  Also reported from Bhutan (Ref. 9418) and Pakistan (Ref. 52665).
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. and R. Britz 2002 Revision of the family Badidae (Teleostei: Perciformes), with description of a new genus and ten new species. Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 13(4):295-372. (Ref. 46238)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia: Pakistan, Nepal, India and Bangladesh.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 15 - 17; Dorsal soft rays (total): 7 - 10; Analsoft rays: 6 - 8; Vertebrae: 26 - 28

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: The species has conspicuous dark blotch covering superficial part of cleithrum above pectoral fin base.  Lacks a dark caudal peduncle blotch.  Body depth 30.7-38.9%SL; interorbital width 6,5-8,3% SL; scales in lateral row 25-27; circumpeduncular scales 19-20; pectoral rays usually 12.  Has a series of prominent dark blotches along dorsal fin base and/or a series of dark blotches along middle of dorsal fin; and has indistinct bars on side. Has a distal extrascapular (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 8.0; dH range: 5 - 19

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#LifeCycle
dataObjects.description: Produces 30-100 eggs. Distinct pairing with embrace (Ref. 31218).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Uses
dataObjects.title: Importance
dataObjects.description: fisheries: of no interest; aquarium: commercial

agents.full_name: Original uploader was Tomolyka at hu.wikipedia

dataObjects.title: File:Fishes of India. Atlas. Plate XXXI.jpg
dataObjects.description: English: 1=1 – Upeneus macronemus (=c|Parupeneus macronemus), 2 – Upeneus luteus (=c|Parupeneus cyclostomus), 3 – Upeneus displurus (=c|Parupeneus ciliatus), 4 – Upeneus indicus (=c| Parupeneus indicus), 5 – c|Plesiops nigricans, 6 – Badis buchanani (=c|Badis badis).

dataObjects.title: File:Blauwe badis (man).jpg
dataObjects.description: Dutch: 1=Een mannelijke blauwe badis (Badis badis). English: 1=A male blue perch (Badis badis). German: 1=Ein männliches Blaubarsch (Badis badis). French: 1=Un mâle perche bleue (Badis badis).

dataObjects.title: File:Blauwe badis (vrouw).jpg
dataObjects.description: Dutch: 1=Een vrouwelijke blauwe badis (Badis badis). English: 1=A female blue perch (Badis badis). German: 1=Ein frauliches Blaubarsch (Badis badis). French: 1=Une femelle perche bleue (Badis badis).
